p: Similarly to isoxanthohumol, 8-prenylnaringenin exhibits several anticarcinogenic activities like strong antiangiogenic effect and the inhibition of survival and proliferation of estrogen-responsive cells by interfering with the PI3K pathway [ 111]. 8-prenylnaringenin was shown to be a better inhibitor of the metabolic activation of IQ [ 82], therefore confirming Plazar’s hypothesis [ 49] that metabolic products of xanthohumol contribute more to its chemoprevention than the xanthohumol itself. Both XN and 8-PN also proved to be strong inhibitors of NF-κB activation in microglial cell lines, thereby possessing the ability to modulate immune responses in the nervous system [ 82].
